narrative.narrative: Emirates SkyCargo is the freight branch of Emirates and is based at Dubai Airport but is building a new terminal at the newer Dubai World Central- Al Maktoum Airport and will soon move there. Their current facility at the older Dubai Airport was opened in 2008 and is on a 43,600 square meter site. They are the third largest cargo airline in the world in terms of freight tonne-kilometres flown as of 2012 after FedEx and UPS having flown 9,319 million tonnes. Their fleet of 12 planes are 10 777F's and 2 747-400ERF's, the two 747's are operated by TNT Airways but are in full Emirates colors. There are three more 777F's on order as of April 2014. They also used to fly a few A310-300F's. They serve 20 destinations globally. It was formed the same year as the passenger airline part of Emirates in 1985.
